notes: Compact rotary-engined car based on Capella (616/618) platform. Available in coupe and sedan body styles. High difficulty modifier reflects specialized rotary engine maintenance including apex seal replacement, oil consumption monitoring, and compression testing requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Capella article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Compact rotary sports car based on Grand Familia platform. Available in multiple body styles. Successful in racing. High difficulty modifier reflects specialized rotary engine maintenance including apex seal replacement, oil consumption monitoring, and compression testing requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda RX-3 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Midsize rotary-engined car based on Luce platform. First Mazda to use 13B rotary engine. Available in multiple body styles. High difficulty modifier reflects specialized rotary engine maintenance including apex seal replacement, oil consumption monitoring, and compression testing requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda RX-4 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation RX-7 sports car with 12A twin-rotor Wankel rotary engine. Launched 1978 as 1979 model year. Lightweight and affordable sports car. High difficulty modifier reflects specialized rotary engine maintenance including apex seal replacement, oil consumption monitoring, and compression testing requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda RX-7 article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Subcompact car marketed as 808 in North America (Grand Familia in Japan). Available in multiple body styles with piston engines. Replaced by GLC/323. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Familia article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Great Little Car (GLC) subcompact. Familia platform with multiple body styles. Transitioned from RWD to FWD during this generation. Fuel-efficient economy car during energy crisis. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Familia article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation B-Series compact pickup (PROCEED in Japan). Available in various displacements throughout decade. Simple and reliable truck design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda B series article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation Cosmo (AP designation) luxury/sports coupe. Available with rotary or piston engines. High difficulty modifier reflects specialized rotary engine maintenance on rotary models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Cosmo article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation 626 (Capella) in North America from late 1970s. Available in multiple body styles. Rear-wheel drive with various piston engine options. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mazda Capella article, December 19, 2024 revision.
